timeline.bodyText:
This actually leaves a race condition open.  The broken sequence would be:

Thread A adds an event to the queue
Thread A calls processEventQueue and schedules the next event
Thread B starts processing the next event and sends all events in the queue, but hasn't yet st processingQueue to false
Thread C adds an event to the queue
Thread C calls processEventQueue which doesn't schedule another event because one is in progress
Thread B sets processingQueue to false

The event from thread C is now left in the queue with no send task scheduled for it.
I'd suggest just using EventThread to queue the send tasks and always schedule another task.  If there is nothing in the queue to publish they will just exit immediately.
